Text:
One day, as Eta wanders around the lab, Epsilon
comes by as usual—
...Huh?

But something is different. Upon hearing her name,
Eta turns around reluctantly as she usually does,
only for a stunned, open-mouth expression to
spread across her face.
...What is it?
You're scaring me...a little...
...She's gone...mute?
...Eta.
She spoke!
I've...got a request. You'll hear me out, won't you?!
A...request?

A demonic expression on her face, Epsilon grabs Eta
by her shoulders, blurting out her plea before the
latter can even respond.

My next performance will take place in the audience
of some very distinguished guests. I want you to make
me a special piano for that occasion.

Pianos...and other musical instruments...should only
be crafted...by artisans.
I'd agree—if we were talking about a normal piano.

But I want to create music that is even more delicate,
music that will soothe the hearts and souls of the
people who hear it. You get it what I mean, right?

...But even if I do...musical instruments...are not
part...of my area of expertise...

It's precisely because they're outside your area of
expertise that you'll be able to create the type of
instrument I want!
So...please, I'm begging you! Make this piano for me!
...You're bowing...to me?!
(This is very...very unusual...)
Okay... I'll try making it.
You will? So that's a "yes"?!
Yeah.

Looking at Epsilon, who finally raises her head, Eta
nods her acquiescence.

After all...you're always looking...after me.
Like...my appearance...
(...though I never...ask for it...)
(Well...I did get to see...something new...)

Oh, Eta, thank you! I'll look forward to what you
come up with!

Eta nods again, and then set herself to work on the
requested piano...

Being a complete amateur at the task at hand—both
in terms of piano-making and music itself—her first
step is to bury herself in books on the subject.
Now that I understand...how they're constructed...
To play with...the differences in the sound...

Mumbling to herself, Eta draws up simple blueprints
for the unique piano she's been commissioned to make.

How are you doing, Eta? I don't know if you'll find
them useful, but I've brought you some materials
we had at home.
...Master.

The voice comes from a young man quietly contemplating
Eta's handiwork—the youth who holds the reigns of the
Shadow Garden.

(...Oh...that caught me...off guard. He's...got no
presence at all.)
You're making a piano?
Epsilon...asked me.

She wants me...to make her a piano...that will
soothe...those who hear its sound.
Soothe? So, like 1/f fluctuations?
...One on ef...what? Master...what do you mean?

Basically, noise that is relaxing, like the sound
of a running river.

...Huh? I've never...head of that. Is this...a new bit
of...Shadow Wisdom?
Master... Do tell me more...!
Yeah, yeah.

Eta eagerly laps up the Shadow Wisdom about 1/f
fluctuations that Cid proceeds to bestow on her.

This is something she'd never heard about, nor read
about in any of the specialty books she'd found. So
she has nothing but the highest regard for Cid, who
reels the information off as if it were nothing.
And that ends the overview. Think you can use it?
Yes...very much so!

A piano...that produces...1/f fluctuations... I'm sure
even Epsilon...will approve!
Thank you...Master!
Just let me listen once you've finished.

And with that, Cid wanders off, leaving Eta to her
work.
Several weeks later...
Eta! You've finished it?! My piano!
Yeah.

You look tired... Don't tell me you worked through
the night?!
It's what...I always do.

Anyway, the result...of chasing after a relaxing
effect...is this "Fluctuating Piano."
"Fluctuating Piano"...? How do I use it?

Play it...while running magical power...through your
fingers. That will produce...a very relaxing...effect.
That's all I need to do?
Yeah.

Nodding in answer to Epsilon's question, Eta stumbles
over to the bed stationed on one side of the laboratory
and flops onto it.
Getting some sleep?
...Yeah.
Can I try the piano out?
Yeah...sure.

No sooner are the words out of Eta's mouth that
Epsilon's fingers begin stroking the keys. Together
with the comforting tones coming from the piano,
her eyelids slowly close.
...Mm...that's right...
Master...wanted to listen...too.
W-Wait, what?!
He...wants to listen to my playing?!
Zzz... Zzz...
Eta, no! Answer me first!

But Epsilon's shouts are to no avail—Eta is already
well and truly lost in dreamland.

Several hours after the "Fluctuating Piano" has been
relocated from Eta's lab...
Zzz... Mhm...*mumble*
As Eta slumbers, curled up on the bed...
Eta! Get up!
What is the meaning of this?!

Forcefully shaken awake, Eta's eyes open under
knit brows.
...Epsilon. What...is it?

Don't give me that! Tell me, just WHAT is going on
with that "Fluctuating Piano" of yours?!
...Say what?

I played it for the rest of the Seven Shadows, and
aside from Lady Alpha and Zeta, everyone fell
asleep!

Even the two of them were nodding off! And this is
the Seven Shadows—what do you think will happen
with the general populace?!
Well...it is meant to be...soothing.
You've overdone it!
But...it's what you asked for...

It's pointless if they can't listen to the entire
piece!

Epsilon stands there with her hands on her hips,
huffing and puffing away.

Peering at her through half-closed lids, Eta thinks
to herself—
(Music...is hard.)

(Putting science...and art together...is far more
difficult...than expected.)

Now I can't get Master Shadow to listen to my playing!
...Oh! But then I can gaze upon his sleeping face...
No! No can do!
(Guess things...didn't turn out so well...this time.)
Etaaa! You listening to me?!

Eta lets Epsilon take out her frustration, rocking
back and forth as she is firmly shaken by her
shoulders while thinking about how to improve
her latest invention.
